Class Pet

java.lang.Object
com.example.Pet
public class Pet extends Object
The Pet class represents a virtual pet with various attributes and behaviours. It tracks the pet's health, sleep, hunger, and happiness levels, along with states like whether the pet is sick, depressed, or starving. The class includes methods for interacting with the pet, such as feeding, playing, exercising, and sleeping.

    • Pet

      public Pet(String name, String type, int happiness, int health, int sleep, int hunger, boolean isSick, boolean isDepressed, boolean isDead, boolean isObey, boolean isStarving, boolean isSleeping)
      Parameterized constructor for manual initialization.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the pet
      type - the type of the pet
      happiness - the happiness level of the pet
      health - the health level of the pet
      sleep - the sleep level of the pet
      hunger - the hunger level of the pet
      isSick - whether the pet is sick
      isDepressed - whether the pet is depressed
      isDead - whether the pet is dead
      isObey - whether the pet is obedient
      isStarving - whether the pet is starving
      isSleeping - whether the pet is sleeping

      Indicates if the pet is sick.
      Returns:
      true if the pet is sick, false otherwise

    • setIsSick

      public void setIsSick(boolean isSick)
      Sets the sick state of the pet. If the pet is sick, a vet button is shown in the UI.
      Parameters:
      isSick - whether the pet is sick

    • getIsDead

      public boolean getIsDead()
      Indicates if the pet is dead.
      Returns:
      true if the pet is dead, false otherwise

    • setIsDead

      public void setIsDead(boolean isDead)
      Sets the dead state of the pet.
      Parameters:
      isDead - whether the pet is dead

    • feed

      public void feed(Item item)
      Feeds the pet using the specified item.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to use for feeding

    • play

      public void play(Item item)
      Allows the pet to play using the specified item.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to use for playing

    • sleep

      public void sleep(Item item)
      Makes the pet sleep using the specified item. Sleeping removes the sick debuff.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to use for sleeping

    • goToVet

      public void goToVet()
      Sends the pet to the vet to heal. Increases health by 30.

    • revivePet

      public void revivePet()
      Revives the pet if the game settings allow revival. Resets all major stats.

    • exercise

      public void exercise()
      Exercises the pet to improve its health. Reduces sleep and hunger.

    • updateStats

      public void updateStats()
      Updates the pet's stats over time. Sleep decreases faster if the pet is sick.

    • updateMood

      public void updateMood()
      Updates the mood of the pet based on its current stats. Changes states like depressed, starving, or sick.

    • depressingState

      public void depressingState()
      Handles the state when the pet is depressed. If happiness reaches 0, ends the game.

    • starvingState

      public void starvingState()
      Handles the state when the pet is starving. Health decreases over time.

    • sleepingState

      public void sleepingState()
      Handles the state when the pet is sleeping. Increases sleep over time and removes sick debuff.

    • sickState

      public void sickState()
      Handles the state when the pet is sick. Decreases health, hunger, and happiness.

    • setGameLoop

      public void setGameLoop(GameLoop gameLoop)
      Sets the game loop for managing runtime behaviours.
      Parameters:
      gameLoop - the game loop to set

    • deadMsg

      public void deadMsg()
      Displays a message indicating the pet is dead and ends the game.

    • sleepMsg

      public void sleepMsg()
      Displays a message indicating the pet is sleeping.

    • warningMsg

      public void warningMsg()
      Displays warning messages based on the pet's current state (e.g., depressed or sick).
